html.p: A new simple, secure, highly performant and scalable endpoint for developers to send JSON application events.

li.a: Sending events to HTTP Event Collector

div.p: In Splunk 6.3 we’ve introduced an exciting new feature for developers to use to send application events directly to Splunk over HTTP/HTTPs without requiring a lot of heavy lifting: the new HTTP Event Collector (HEC).

The new HTTP Event Collector uses a new token-based authentication model that is not tied to a Splunk user. In the Data Inputs manager you can create one or more tokens. Once you have a valid token, you can easily send events from your applications using any HTTP Client, logging libraries, or a tool like curl.

HEC is designed for scale. You can start with a single deployment, using it out of the box, without deploying anything additional. As the number of clients sending events or number of events grow, it can be scaled out to support potentially hundreds of thousands or even millions of events.
Below is a quick walkthrough to get you up to speed using the collector.
By default HTTP Event Collector is disabled. You can enable it by going to Settings>Data Inputs>HTTP Event Collector. Then click the Global Settings button in the corner.
This will bring up a configuration screen for HEC, which is disabled by default. Click the Enable button, and then click Save.
Once HEC is enabled, you can create a token for sending events. Click on the New Token button:
This will bring up the Add Data page where you can define a new token.
Enter a name for the token, and optionally complete the other fields. When you’re done, click Next.
From this screen you can further configure your token. Select “main” from the Default Index pop-up menu. Then click Review to review the details of your new token.
Click Submit and the token is created.
Right-click on the string in the Token Value field and copy the value to the clipboard. You’ll use the token value when you send your HTTP request to HEC.
Click the Start Searching button to bring up a search for events for your new token.
